description: Designing and protecting network infrastructure and communication channels.
reference: CISSP CBK Domain 4: Communication and Network Security

description: Structure and design of networks to ensure security and performance.
Seven-layer model for network communication: Physical, Data Link, Network, Transport, Session, Presentation, Application.
OSI Layer 1: Handles physical connections and transmission of raw bits.
OSI Layer 2: Manages node-to-node data transfer and error detection.
OSI Layer 3: Handles routing and forwarding of packets, e.g., IP.
OSI Layer 4: Ensures reliable data transfer, e.g., TCP, UDP.
OSI Layer 5: Manages sessions between applications.
OSI Layer 6: Handles data formatting, encryption, and compression.
OSI Layer 7: Provides network services directly to applications, e.g., HTTP.
